{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.04545v1", "title": "Column bounded matrices and Grothendieck's inequalities", "summary": "It follows from Grothendieck's little inequality that to any complex (m x n)
matrix X of column norm at most 1, and an 0 <e <1, there exist a natural number
q, an (m x q) matrix C with
  $(1-e)^2 \leq CC^* \leq (4/\pi) (1 + e)^2$
  and an (q x n ) matrix Z with entries in the complex torus such that X=
q$^{-(1/2)}$(CZ). Both of Grothendieck's complex inequalities follow from this
factorization result.", "main_category": "math.FA", "categories": "math.FA", "published": "2025-05-07T16:27:01Z"}
